parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>0.76</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Inventory </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Vehicle Inventory </value></part><part><name>GROUP2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns array of arrays of all vehicle's magazines and their ammo count (also works on supply boxes). When applied to a unit (soldier), the command behaves differently and will omit magazines already loaded into unit's weapons. Use [[magazinesAmmoFull]] to return all magazines.

<br><br>'''Output format''':

<br>[[magazine1],[magazine2],[magazine3]...[magazineN]]

<br><br>'''Magazine format''':

<br>0: Magazine class name

<br>1: Magazine current ammo count </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[magazinesAmmo]] vehicle </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]] - unit or vehicle or container. When transport is supplied, the command returns vehicle's magazines not the cargo. When container is supplied, the command behaves identically to [[magazinesAmmoCargo]]  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name> s2</name>=<value> [[magazinesAmmo]] [vehicle, includeEmpty] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(Since Arma 3 v1.99.146475)</value></part><part><name>SYNTAX2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> [vehicle, includeEmpty]: [[Array]]  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER21</name>=<value> 
</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]] - unit or vehicle.  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER22</name>=<value> 
</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> includeEmpty (Optional): [[Boolean]] - [[true]] to include empty magazines. Default: [[false]]  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER23</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name> r2</name>=<value>[[Array]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE2</name>=<value> 
 
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value><code>_magazinesAmmo = [[magazinesAmmo]] [[player]];
/*
[
	["30Rnd_65x39_caseless_mag",30],
	["30Rnd_65x39_caseless_mag",30],
	["16Rnd_9x21_Mag",16],
	["SmokeShellGreen",1],
	["Chemlight_green",1],
	["HandGrenade",1]
]
<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>*/</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext></code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value><code>_magazinesAmmo = [[magazinesAmmo]] Mi_48;
/*
[
	["250Rnd_30mm_APDS_shells",250],
	["250Rnd_30mm_HE_shells",250],
	["8Rnd_LG_scalpel",8],
	["38Rnd_80mm_rockets",38]
]
<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>*/</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext></code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[magazinesAmmoFull]], [[magazinesAmmoCargo]], [[magazinesDetail]], [[magazines]], [[magazinesTurret]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="7"/><value>  </value></part><part><name>MPBEHAVIOUR</name>=<value>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on December 20, 2014 - 14:41 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Actium|Actium]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
When used on vehicles this will only return all magazines associated with a single turretPath (which one depends on the actual armament of the vehicle, usually the first armed turretPath or alternatively turretPath [-1]). <br>
If you want to get all turrets' magazines, use [[allTurrets]] and [[magazinesTurret]].
--[[User:Actium|Actium]] ([[User talk:Actium|talk]]) 15:41, 20 December 2014 (CET)
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
